Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mastoparan-D (Mastoparan-T; Ala-rich; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (92.86%) toMastoparan MMol formula: C73H129N17O16Mol Wt: 1513.922; Mol Ex Coeff: 0; GRAVY: 1.086.Activity:  Active against Gram+ S. aureus CCRC12652 or CCRC15211 (MIC 24-32 ug/ml), S. xylosus  (MIC 2 ug/ml), S. alactolyticus (MIC 16 ug/ml), Gram- C. koseri, E. coli BL21 or JM109 Amp (MIC 8 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae CCRC10694 (MIC 32 ug/ml), S. Choleraesuis  (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. typhimurium CCRC12947  (MIC 32 ug/ml), V. parahamelytics CCRC10806 (MIC 32 ug/ml), and P.aeruginosa (MIC 128 ug/ml).Structure:  the peptide is helical in 8 mM SDS or 40% TFE (CD).Toxicity:  hRBC: not hemo.lytic till 64 ug/ml; <5% hemolysis at 128 uM, HC50 > 256 ug/ml (20% hemolysis). Similar results were obtained using chicken and sheep RBC.Updated 8/2024
Literature Information.Author: Lin CH, Tzen JT, Shyu CL, Yang MJ, Tu WC.2011
Literature Information.Title: Structural and biological characterization of mastoparans in the venom of Vespa species in Taiwan
